gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ੲੇਕਨਿ ਚੋਟਿ ਨਿਫੋਟ ਬਹੀ ॥ ਤਰਵਾ ਤਰ ਹੁਅੈ ਤਰਵਾਰ ਰਹੀ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Soor Ekan(i) Chottee Niphot Badoo|| Tarvaa Tar Huai Tarvaar Rahoo||18||
translation: On the heads of some of them she struck such a mighty blow, that the bodies were pierced from the heads to the foot-palm.

gurmukhi: ਤਨ ਝੱਝਰ ਹੁਅੈ ਰਣ ਭੂਮ ਗਿਰੇ ॥ ੲਿਕ ਭਾਜ ਚਲੇ ਫਿਰ ਕੈ ਨ ਫਿਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Tan Jhajjhar Huai Ran Bhoom Gire|| Ik Bhaaj Chale Phir Kai Na Phire||
translation: The decayed bodies fell in the battlefield; some ran away and did not return;

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਿ ਹਾਥ ਹਥਿਅਾਰ ਲੈ ਅਾਨ ਬਹੇ ॥ ਲਰਿ ਕੈ ਮਰਿ ਕੈ ਗਿਰਿ ਖੇਤ ਰਹੇ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Ik(i) Haath Hathiaar Lai Aan Bahe|| Lar(i) Kai Mar(i) Kai Gir(i) Khet Rahe||19||
translation: Some have caught hold of weapons and entered the battlefield; and after fighting have died and fallen in the field.19.

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ਸੁ ਦੈਤ ਰਾਜਯੰ ॥ ਸਜੇ ਸੁ ਸਰਬ ਸਾਜਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Tahaan Su Dait Raajayan|| Saje Su Sarab Saajayan||
translation: Then the demon-king gathered all the war-paraphernalis.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਰੰਗ ਅਾਪ ਬਾਹੀਯੰ ॥ ਬਧੰ ਸੁ ਮਾਤ ਚਾਹੀਯੰ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Turan Aap Baahooyan|| Badhan Su Maat Chaahooyan||20||
translation: He drove his horse forward and wanted to kill the Mother (goddess).20.

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਦ੍ਰੁਗਾ ਬਕਾਰਿ ਕੈ ॥ ਕਮਾਣ ਬਾਣ ਧਾਰਿ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Tabai Drougad Badaar(i) Kai|| Kamaan Baan Ddaar(i) Kai||
translation: Then the goddess Durga challenged him, taking up her bow and arrows;

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਘਾਵ ਚਾਮਰੰ ਕੀਯੋ ॥ ੳੁਤਾਰ ਹਸਤ ਤੇ ਦੀਯੋ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Su Ghaav Chaamaran Kooyo|| Outaar Hasat Te Dooyo||21||
translation: She wounded (one of) the generals named Chamar and threw him down on the ground from his elephatnt.21

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਬੀਰ ਕੋਪੰ ਬਿੜਾਲਾਛ ਨਾਮੰ ॥ ਸਜੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਦੇਹੰ ਦਲੋ ਜੁੱਧ ਧਾਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Tabai Boor Kopan Bidaalaachh Naamannd|| Saje Sastra Dehan Chalo Juddh Dhaamannd||
translation: Then the hero named Biralachh was filled with ire. He bedecked himself with weapons and walked towards the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੰ ਸਿੰਘ ਕੇ ਅਾਨ ਘਾਯੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰ ॥ ਬਲੀ ਸਿੰਘ ਸੋ ਹਾਥ ਸੋ ਮਾਰਿ ਡਾਰੰ ॥੨੨॥
transliteration: Siran Singh Ke Aan Ghaayan Prahaaran|| Badoo Singh So Haath So Daar(i) Daaran||22||
translation: He struck his weapon on the head of the lion and wounded him, but the brave lion killed him with his hands.22.

gurmukhi: ਬਿੜਾਲਾਛ ਮਾਰੇ ਸੁ ਪਿੰਗਾਛ ਧਾੲੇ ॥ ਦ੍ਰੁਗਾ ਸਾਮੁਹੇ ਬੋਲ ਬਾਂਕੇ ਸੁਨਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Bidaalaachh Mdare Su Pingadchh Dhaae|| Drougad Saamuhe Bol Baanke Sounaae||
translation: When Biralachh was killed, Pinagachh ran forward; going in front of Durga, he uttered some inronical words.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀ ਅੱਭ੍ਰਿ ਜਯੋਂ ਗਰਜ ਕੈ ਬਾਣ ਬਰਖੰ ॥ ਮਹਾਂ ਸੂਰ ਬੀਰੰ ਭਰੇ ਜੁੱਧ ਹਰਖੰ ॥੨੩॥
transliteration: Daroo Abbhr(i) Jyon Gadaj Kai Baan Barakhannd|| Mahaan Soor Booran Bhare Juddh Harakhannd||23||
translation: Roaring like a cloud, he showered a volley of arrows; that great hero was filled with pleasure in the battlefield.23.

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਦੇਵੀਅੰ ਪਾਣ ਬਾਣੰ ਸੰਭਾਰੰ ॥ ਹਨਿਓ ਦੁਸਟ ਕੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਸੀਸੰ ਮਝਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Tabai Devooan Paan Baanan Sanbhaaran|| Hanio Doust Ke Ghaae Soosan Majhaaran||
translation: Then the goddess caught hold of her bow and arrows. She wounded the tyrant on his head with her shaft;
